function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited access to working from home for some people based on socioeconomic status, leading to challenges in social distancing and infection prevention.","Impact":"Increased risk of infection and spread of contagious diseases among individuals with limited access to working from home.","Mitigation":"Provide support and resources for individuals in lower socioeconomic groups to enable working from home, and implement measures to support social distancing in workplaces.","Technologies":"Flexible working technologies, remote communication tools, and workplace design solutions that enable social distancing.","People":"People in lower socioeconomic groups, individuals working in shared facilities and crowded spaces.","Owner":"Employers, government, and urban planners."},{"Description":"Challenges with social distancing and infection prevention in smaller and crowded houses or spaces without outside areas.","Impact":"Increased risk of infection and spread of contagious diseases due to limited space for social distancing and outdoor activities.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to support social distancing in crowded living environments, and consider urban planning strategies for creating more open and accessible outdoor spaces.","Technologies":"Urban design solutions for creating open public spaces, remote communication tools for virtual social interactions.","People":"Individuals living in smaller and crowded houses, urban residents in densely populated areas.","Owner":"Urban planners, government, and community organizations."},{"Description":"Impact of COVID-19 on urban design and public spaces, with potential for increased risk of disease transmission in crowded urban environments.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease transmission and spread in densely populated urban areas without adequate infrastructure for infection prevention.","Mitigation":"Incorporate urban design strategies that prioritize social distancing, pedestrian-friendly infrastructure, and improved public spaces to reduce the risk of disease transmission in urban environments.","Technologies":"Urban planning technologies for redesigning public spaces, digital tools for assessing urban density and pedestrian flow.","People":"Urban residents, commuters, public space users.","Owner":"Urban planners, government, and architects."}]}
